question.title: Setting JAVA_HOME in Mac (not personal)
question.body:
I got a Mac (M3 pro) for work. I have installed Java 17 (Temurin) and Java 8 (Amazon) for a project specific requirement. Now when I tried to set the JAVA_HOME (export JAVA_HOME="/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/temurin-17.0.10/Contents/Home"), I get the following message when I try to echo $JAVA_HOME: "Using system JDK, no JAVA_HOME set!".

I am facing this problem for past 3 days. Please help me in this regard.

I was trying to set the JAVA_HOME and using the export JAVA_HOME="/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/temurin-17.0.10/Contents/Home" in .zshrc file. When running the direct export cmd in terminal as well as iTerm2 also, JAVA_HOME is not set. When I try to echo $JAVA_HOME I get the following message:

Using system JDK, no JAVA_HOME set!

I am not sure is it permissions issue on my Mac or a Java installation issue.
